Posts.Content: Sep 10, 2008 07:45PM mrsisaak wrote: Hi islita - I just had my first mammogram today (39) and was also found to asymmetric density.  I've been doing some searching on the web and, from what I've learned, the breasts should have close to equal density between the two of them.  When one is denser than the other, there is about a 12% chance that it could be cancerous.  But think of the 88% chance of it being something else. :) Hope you (and I) fall into that 88%.
Posts.Title: Asymetric Density islita Shirlann
